TURTWIG.description:
The shell on its back is made of soil. 
On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell 
should feel moist. The leaf on its head
wilts if it is thirsty.

GROTLE.description:
A Grotle that lives in the forest is said
to have its own secret springwater well. 
It carries fellow Pokémon there on 
its back.

TORTERRA.description:
Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra's
back and spend their entire life there.
Ancient people imagined that beneath 
the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.

CHIMCHAR.description:
Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made
in its belly. Before going to sleep,
Chimchar extinguish the flame on their
tails to prevent fires.

MONFERNO.description:
It carefully controls the intensity of
the flame on its tail, so as to keep its
foes at an adequate distance.
Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

INFERNAPE.description:
Its crown of fire is indicative of its
fiery nature. It uses a special kind of
martial arts involving all of its limbs to
take on any opponent.

PIPLUP.description:
A poor walker, it often falls down. However,
its strong pride makes it puff up its chest
without a care. It's difficult to bond with
since it won't listen to its Trainer.

PRINPLUP.description:
Because every Prinplup considers itself
to be the most important, they can never
form a group. It searches for prey in
icy seas.

EMPOLEON.description:
The three horns that extend from its
beak attest to its power. It avoids
unnecessary disputes, but it will decimate
anything that threatens its pride.

STARLY.description:
They flock around mountains and fields,
chasing after bug Pokémon. However,
they bicker if the group grows too big.
Their singing is noisy and annoying.

STARAVIA.description:
Recognizing their own weakness, they
maintain huge flocks. Fierce scuffles
break out between various flocks.
When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

STARAPTOR.description:
When Staravia evolve into Staraptor,
they leave the flock to live alone. It has
a savage nature. It will courageously
challenge foes that are much larger.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
243
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_6
218
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
214
#else
172
#endif

BIDOOF.description:
A comparison revealed that Bidoof's front
teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata's.
It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to
whittle down its front teeth.

BIBAREL.description:
It makes its nest by damming streams
with bark and mud. A river dammed by
Bibarel will never overflow its banks,
which is appreciated by people nearby.

KRICKETOT.description:
It shakes its head back to front,
causing its antennae to hit each other
and sound like a xylophone.
These sounds are fall hallmarks.

KRICKETUNE.description:
It signals its emotions with its melodies.
There is a village that hosts a contest
based on the amazingly variable cries
of this Pokémon.

SHINX.description:
It rapidly contracts and relaxes its
muscles to generate electricity. Its
body shines if endangered. It flees
while the foe is momentarily blinded.

LUXIO.description:
Strong electricity courses through the
tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch
has enough amperage to cause fainting
in foes.

LUXRAY.description:
It has eyes which can see through
anything. Luxray's ability to see
through objects comes in handy when
it's scouting for danger.

CRANIDOS.description:
A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million
years ago, its skull is as hard as iron. 
It would snap obstructing trees with
headbutts.

RAMPARDOS.description:
The result of repeated headbutts
is a skull grown thick and hard.
However, its brain has shrunk in size
compared with Cranidos's.

SHIELDON.description:
This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles.
Few enemies would have been willing to
square off against its heavily armored
face, so it's thought.

BASTIODON.description:
Their rock-hard faces serve to protect
them from any frontral attacks.
When attacked, they form a wall.
They shielded their young in that way.

COMBEE.description:
A Pokémon formed by three others.
It constantly gathers honey from flowers
to please Vespiquen. At night, they
cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

VESPIQUEN.description:
It houses its colony in cells in its body
and releases various pheromones to
make those grubs do its bidding.
There is only one in a colony.

PACHIRISU.description:
A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek
pouches together in an effort to share
stored electricity. It stores them with
berries in tree holes.

BUIZEL.description:
It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its
face above water in order to watch for
prey movement. It swims by rotating its
two tails like a screw.

FLOATZEL.description:
Its flotation sac developed as a result
of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double
as a rubber raft. It assists in the rescues
of drowning people.

CHERUBI.description:
The small ball holds the nutrients needed
for evolution. Apparently, it is also very
sweet and tasty. Pokémon like Starly and
Taillow try to peck it off.

DRIFLOON.description:
Because of the way it floats aimlessly,
an old folktale calls it a “Signpost for
Wandering Spirits.” Children holding
them sometimes vanish.

DRIFBLIM.description:
Even while under careful observation,
large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk
will inexplicably disappear from view.
No one knows where they go.

BUNEARY.description:
You can tell how it feels by the way
it rolls its ears. When it's scared,
both ears are rolled up. When it senses
danger, it perks them up.

LOPUNNY.description:
An extremely cautious Pokémon.
It is very conscious of its looks and
never fails to groom its ears.
It runs with sprightly jumps.

MEGA.description:
Mega Evolution awakens its combative
instincts. It has shed any fur that got in
the way of its attacks.
crescent.

GLAMEOW.description:
It is a very fickle Pokémon, which is 
very popular among some. It claws its
Trainer's nose if it isn't fed and
purrs when affectionate.

PURUGLY.description:
It is a brazen brute that barges its way
into another Pokémon's nest and claims
it as its own. It binds its body with its
tails to make itself look bigger.

STUNKY.description:
It protects itself by spraying a
nose-curling, stinky fluid from its rear
to repel attackers. The stench lingers
for 24 hours.

SKUNTANK.description:
It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly
fluid from the tip of its tail. The fluid
smells worse the longer it is allowed
to fester.

BRONZOR.description:
Implements shaped like it were discovered
in ancient tombs. There are researchers
who believe this Pokémon reflected like a
mirror in the distant past.

BRONZONG.description:
In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as
a bringer of rain. One caused a news stir
when it was dug up at a construction site
after a 2000-year sleep.

CHATOT.description:
It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to
trick them into thinking it's one of them.
This way they won't attack it. It can
also learn and speak human words.

SPIRITOMB.description:
A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits.
Its constant mischief and misdeeds
resulted in it being bound to an
Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

GIBLE.description:
It nests in horizontal holes warmed by
geothermal heat. Foes who stray too
close can expect to be pounced on
and bitten.

GABITE.description:
Shiny objects are its passion. It can be
found in its cave, scarcely moving,
its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed
or Carbink it has caught.

GARCHOMP.description:
When it folds up its body and extends its
wings, it looks like a jet plane. It is
covered in fine scales that reduce drag,
enabling it to fly at high speeds.

MEGA.description:
Excess energy melted its arms and wings
into giant scythes, sending it mad with
rage. It swings its scythes wildly and
slices the ground to pieces.

RIOLU.description:
It can discern the physical and emotional
states of people, Pokémon, and other
natural things from the shape of their
aura waves.

LUCARIO.description:
It understands human speech.
It is said that no foe can remain invisible
to Lucario, since it can detect Auras.
Even foes it could not otherwise see.

MEGA.description:
It readies itself to face its enemies by
focusing its mental energies. Its fighting
style can be summed up in a single word:
heartless.

HIPPOPOTAS.description:
Hippopotas shuts its nostrils tight when
travelling through sand. Instead of
perspiration, it expels grains of sand
from its body.

HIPPOWDON.description:
It is surprisingly quick to anger.
It brandishes its gaping mouth in a
display of fearsome strength and raises
vast quantities of sand while attacking.

SKORUPI.description:
It grips prey with its tail claws and
injects poison. It tenaciously hangs
on until the poison takes.
It can survive a year without food.

DRAPION.description:
Possessing a sturdy build, it takes
pride in its strength. It has the power
in its clawed arms to make scrap
out of a car.

CROAGUNK.description:
Croagunk rarely fights fairly. Inflating
its poison sacs, it fills the area with
an odd sound and hits flinching
opponents with a poison jab.

TOXICROAK.description:
Swaying and dodging the attacks
of its foes, it weaves its flexible body
in close, then lunges out with its
poisonous claws.

CARNIVINE.description:
Hanging from branches using its
tentacles, it looks like a plant.
It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling
saliva, then chomps down.

FINNEON.description:
Its double tail fins propel its energetic
jumps. When it breaks the surface of the
sea, Wingull swoop down to grab it on
the fly.

LUMINEON.description:
Lumineon swimming in the darkness
of the deep sea look like stars shining
in the night sky. It competes for food
with Lanturn.

SNOVER.description:
During cold seasons, it migrates to the
mountain's lower reaches. Seemingly
curious about people, they gather around
footsteps they find on snowy mountains.

ABOMASNOW.description:
It lives a quiet life on mountains that
are perpetually covered in snow. It hides
itself by whipping up blizzards.
It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”

MEGA.description:
The sprouts on Abomasnow's back grow into
great shafts of ice when it Mega Evolves.
Dislikes associating with others and
chooses to live quietly deep in mountains.

HEAT.description:
If the convection microwave oven is
not working properly, then the Rotom
inhabiting it will become lethargic. It
makes mischief by turning up the heat.

WASH.description:
It enjoys coming up with water-based
pranks. The model of washing machine that
Rotom can inspirit has been discontinued,
so they are now traded at high prices.

FROST.description:
In this form, Rotom likes to play freezing
cold pranks. You may find it's turned the
bath you just filled to solid ice!
It battles by spewing cold air.

FAN.description:
The first appliance developed that Rotom
coud inspirit was the electric fan. It uses
its power over wind in its pranks, happily
blowing any important documents it finds.

MOW.description:
The lawn mower is an appliance that led to
the development of the Rotom Dex. It will
mow down grass and flowers, then swagger
around with pride at its accomplishments.

UXIE.description:
Known as ”The Being of Knowledge,”
according to some sources, this Pokémon
provided people with the intelligence
necessary to solve various problems.

MESPRIT.description:
Although it slumbers at the bottom of a
lake, its spirit is said to leave its body
and flitter on the water surface. It
taught humans of sorrow, pain, and joy.

AZELF.description:
This Pokémon is said to have endowed
humans with the determination needed to
do things. It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit
and Azelf all came from the same egg.

DIALGA.description:
A Pokémon spoken of in legend.
It completely controls the flow of time.
It uses its power to travel at will
through the past and future.

ORIGIN.description:
Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a
form bearing a striking resemblance to the
creator Pokémon. It wields such a colossal
strength that this might be its true form.

PALKIA.description:
Palkia has the ability to distort space.
Its total control over the boundaries of
space enable it to transport itself to
faraway places and other dimensions.

ORIGIN.description:
It soars across the sky in a form that
resembles the creator of all things.
Perhaps this imitation of appearance is a
strategy for gaining Arceus's powers.

HEATRAN.description:
Boiling blood, like magma, circulates
through its body. It dwells in volcanic
caves, using its cross-shaped feet
to crawl on ceilings and walls.

REGIGIGAS.description:
There is an enduring legend that
states this Pokémon shaped Regirock,
Regice, and Registeel out of clay, ice,
and magma.

CRESSELIA.description:
Those who sleep holding one of
Cresselia's feathers are assured of
joyful dreams. It is said to represent
the crescent moon.

expYield.raw:
#if P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_9
290
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_8
300
#elif P_UPDATED_EXP_YIELDS >= GEN_5
270
#else
210
#endif

PHIONE.description:
When the water warms, they inflate the
flotation sac on their heads and drift
languidly on the sea in packs.
It always returns to where it was born.

MANAPHY.description:
Water makes up 80% of its body.
It starts its life with a wondrous power
that permits it to bond with any kind
of Pokémon.

DARKRAI.description:
It chases people and Pokémon from its
territory by causing them to experience
deep, nightmarish slumbers. However,
it means no harm.

PLANT.description:
If its cloak is even slightly damaged, it
will immediately repair it with whatever is
near at hand. The Pokémon within the cloak
is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.

SANDY.description:
It weaves a cloak together with sand, mud,
and silk it spits out. This earthen cloak
is ruined by wind and rain, so the Pokémon
hides away in caves and other such places.

TRASH.description:
When confronted by a lack of other
materials, Burmy will create its cloak
using dust and refuse. The cloak seems to
be more comfortable than one would think.

OVERCAST.description:
It's motionless, save for the occasional
quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be
found gathered around it, drawn by the
scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.

SUNSHINE.description:
Cherrim takes this form on sunny days.
Its faint scent entices bug Pokémon to it.
It immediately closes its petals and
becomes immobile once the sun hides.

WEST.description:
It appears on shallow-water beaches to
eat sand for nourishment. Should one
Gastrodon encounter another of a
different color, a fierce battle will ensue.

EAST.description:
Found more often on land than in the sea.
They normally live in rocky seashores, but
when cloudy or rainy, they can sometimes
be found on mountains, far from the sea.

ALTERED.description:
This Pokémon is said to live in a world
on the reverse side of ours, where common
knowledge is distorted and strange.
It was banished for its violence.

ORIGIN.description:
Giratina loses its legs upon changing into
this form. It's believed it hails from a
world where the heavens and the earth
are as one.

LAND.description:
The flowers all over its body bloom if it is
lovingly hugged and senses gratitude. It
dissolves toxins in the air to transform
ruined land into a lush field of flowers.

SKY.description:
Upon taking in the scent of a particular
rare flower, Shaymin is enveloped in light
and its tiny body transforms, confering
the power of flight upon it.

WEST.description:
It oozes a purple fluid to deter enemies.
While harmless, the fluid is awfully sticky.
Apparently, there are more West Sea
Shellos now than there were in the past.

EAST.description:
It's capable of spending a limited amount
of time on land until their skin dries out.
One theory suggests that living in cold
seas causes Shellos to take on this form.

PLANT.description:
Its appearance changes depending
on where Burmy evolved. The materials
on hand become a part of its body.
The cloak is never shed.

SANDY.description:
Its earthen skin is reasonably hard, it has
no problem repelling a Starly's pecking.
It is said that a Wormadam that evolves
on a cold day will have a thicker cloak.

TRASH.description:
Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to
the scenery enough to be inconspicuous.
This seems to be the perfect way for it to
evade the detection of predators.
